title_en: Turkish air traffic controllers have gone on strike - flights are massively delayed in Antalya
summary_en:
Turkish air traffic controllers at Antalya Airport have gone on strike over demands for higher wages and better working conditions.
During the high tourist season, the load on dispatchers increases, and they work in "shock mode".
The strike is taking place within the framework of the "Work without Initiative" program, which means that only half of the planned plan is completed.
Instead of 90 flights per hour, no more than 40 take off, which led to serious disruptions in air traffic to the resort.
The travel industry is concerned about the possible disruption of the tourist season and calls for a resolution of the conflict in order to restore the operation of the airport.
The situation is aggravated by the change in tourist preferences among Turkish residents who prefer foreign resorts.
High prices at Turkish resorts also scare away tourists, despite discounts.

title: –°–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∏ –∞–ª–µ–∫—Å–∏–Ω—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —Å–∫–ª–∞–¥–∞ Wildberries –≥—Ä–æ–∑—è—Ç –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–æ–π –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –Ω–µ–≤–æ–∑–º–æ–∂–Ω–æ–π –∂–∞—Ä—ã
title_en: Employees of the Aleksinsky Wildberries warehouse threaten to strike due to the impossible heat
summary_en:
It is impossible to stay in the warehouse due to non-working air conditioners and lack of ventilation.
The management forbade bringing water, and people are forced to drink from the tap.
Some employees became ill, and one girl needed an ambulance.
10 thousand people in the warehouse are not provided with medical care.
After complaints, the management allowed to take water with them, but the air conditioners still do not work.
